column1: JINYA Ramen Bar - Houston////This place is SO. GOOD. I went there with some friends and we were really impressed by the food and service (our waitress
column3: was the best). We had the Brussels sprouts tempura and some pork buns for an appetizer and they were both amazing
column4: and I had the special Cha Cha Cha garlic ramen with some fresh (and free) garlic on the side. I don't know if the kitchen got confused by my love for garlic
column5: but the ramen didn't taste garlicky at first until I squeezed in a few bulbs
column6: but that was fine because it was so delicious afterwards. Definitely still worth 5 stars. If I could handle that kind of sodium intake multiple times a week
column7: I would definitely be back sooner.
